text: Miranda Leigh Lambert (born November 10, 1983) is an American country music artist who gained fame as a finalist on the 2003 season of Nashville Star, where she finished in third place and later signed to Epic Records. She was married to country singer Blake Shelton whom divorced in 2015. She married NYPD officer Brendan McLoughlin on January 26, 2019. She has four solo albums released as of 2011 and one with country supergroup Pistol Annies. Some of her most known songs are "Gunpowder and Lead", "Kerosene", "The House That Built Me", "White Liar", "Heart Like Mine", and "Baggage Claim". ==Discography== ;Studio albums * Kerosene (2005) * Crazy Ex-Girlfriend (2007) * Revolution (2009) * Four the Record (2011) * Platinum (2014) * The Weight of These Kings (2016) * Wildcard (2019) * Palomino (2022) * Postcards from Texas (2024) ;Collaborative albums * The Marfa Tapes (with Jack Ingram and Jon Randall) (2021) ;Singles * "Fastest Girl in Town" (2012) * "Tin Man" (2017) ==Related pages== * List of country musicians from Texas ==References== Category:1983 births Category:Living people Category:Country musicians Category:Singers from Texas Category:Columbia Records artists Category:RCA Records artists
title: Miranda Lambert
